meanings.sent1: He rebored the hole in the wood to make it deeper.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic rebored the engine cylinder to improve performance.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter accidentally rebored the hole too wide, oops!
meanings.sent4: Her words rebored into his heart, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the drill rebored through the silence of the room.

meanings.definition: To make (a hole) larger by boring again.
meanings.sent1: They rebored the tunnel to allow for larger vehicles to pass through.
meanings.sent2: The miner rebored the shaft to increase the flow of air in the mine.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel rebored the hole in the tree to fit its growing family.
meanings.sent4: His laughter rebored through the tension in the room, easing the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The river rebored its path through the rocky terrain over centuries.
